Welcome to simsoexp’s documentation!¶

Contents:

class simsoexp.clientapi.simsodb.DBConfFile(db, testset, identifier)¶

Represents a configuration file taken from a remote Simso Experiment Database.

configuration¶
Returns:the Simso configuration object represented by this configuration file.
Return type:simso.configuration.Configuration
content¶
Returns:this configuration file’s XML content.
Return type:str
class simsoexp.clientapi.simsodb.DBResults(db, identifier)¶

Represents a results set from a remote Simso Experiment Database. These results contains : - the scheduler and testset identifiers in the database used to build the experiment. - the resulting metrics

metrics¶
Returns:A dictionnary containing a set of metrics indexed by their name.
Return type:dict of dict
scheduler_id¶
Returns:The id of the scheduler used to build these results.
Return type:int
testset_id¶
Returns:The id of the testset used to build these results.
Return type:int
class simsoexp.clientapi.simsodb.DBScheduler(db, identifier)¶

Represents a scheduler taken from a remote Simso Experiment Database.

class_name¶
Returns:the scheduler’s main class in the scheduler’s code
Return type:str
cls¶
Returns:the scheduler’s class object.
Return type:type
code¶
Returns:this scheduler’s python code
Return type:str
name¶
Returns:this scheduler visible name
Return type:str
push(newdb)¶

Pushes this DBScheduler object to another database. Note : this scheduler might need to be validated by the maintainers of the destination database.

Parameters:newdb (SimsoDatabase) – Destination database where the object will be pushed.
class simsoexp.clientapi.simsodb.DBTestSet(db, identifier)¶

Represents a test set taken from a remote Simso Experiment Database.

categories¶
Returns:This test set’s categories as a list.
Return type:list of string
conf_files¶
Returns:a list of DBConfFile object for each configuration file in this test set.
Return type:list of DBConfFile
description¶
Returns:The description of the test set.
Return type:str
name¶
Returns:The name of the test set
Return type:str
push(newdb)¶

Pushes this DBTestset object to another database. Note : this testset might need to be validated by the maintainers of the destination database.

Parameters:newdb (SimsoDatabase) – Destination database where the object will be pushed.
class simsoexp.clientapi.simsodb.Experiment(db, conf_files, scheduler)¶
Represent an experiment, which contains :
  • a set of configuration files
  • a scheduler
  • after run() : a set of metrics and results
run()¶

Runs the experiment and computes the metrics.

upload()¶

Uploads the experiment results to Simso Experiment Database.

An ApiError will be raised if the results of the experiment already exist.

Note you won’t be able to upload your results if you used a custom test set.

Raises ApiError:
 the operation is not allowed (see exception details).
class simsoexp.clientapi.simsodb.SimsoDatabase(address, username=None, password=None)¶

SimsoDatabase is the main component of the Simso Experiment Platform API.

categories()¶
Returns:a list of all the test categories in the database.
Return type:list of str
Raises HttpError:
 there was an error in the request.
categories_and_description()¶
Returns:a list of tuples (category_name, description) for each test category.
Return type:list of (str, str)
Raises HttpError:
 there was an error in the request.
result(identifier)¶
Returns:a result set given its identifier in the database.
Return type:DBResults
results(testset, scheduler)¶

Gets the results associated to the given testset and scheduler. These results have been obtained by running simso with the corresponding scheduler and testsets.

Parameters:
  • testset (DBTestSet) – A DBTestSet instance.
  • scheduler (DBScheduler) – A DBScheduler instance.
Returns:

The results corresponding to the given scheduler and testset.
Return type:

list of DBResults
Raises HttpError:
 

there was an error in the request.
scheduler(identifier)¶
Returns:a scheduler given its id in the database.
Return type:DBScheduler
scheduler_by_name(name='')¶
Parameters:

name (str) – The exact name of the schedulers to find.
Returns:

a scheduler given its name in the database.
Return type:

DBScheduler
Raises:
  • HttpError – there was an error in the request.
  • ApiError – the scheduler with the given name does not exist.
testset(identifier)¶
Parameters:identifier (int) – The identifier of the testset to retrieve.
Returns:DBTestset instance whose id is identifier
Return type:DBTestset
testset_by_name(name)¶
Returns:DBTestset instance whose name is name
Return type:DBTestset
testsets(category='')¶

Gets a list of testsets given a category. If no category is specified, all the testsets are returned.

Parameters:category (str) – the category of testsets to display.
Returns:list of testsets given a category.
Return type:list of DBTestSet
Raises HttpError:
 there was an error in the request.
upload_scheduler(name, class_name, code)¶

Uploads a scheduler with the given name, class name and code to the database.

The scheduler will be available in the database as soon as it is validated by a maintainer.

If a VALIDATED scheduler with the same name already exists, an ApiError is raised. If a non-validated scheduler with the same name already exists, it will be overriden if you are the author of the existing scheduler.

Parameters:
  • name (str) – name of the scheduler to upload. Should be unique.
  • class_name (str) – name of the main class of the scheduler in the code.
  • code (str) – python code of the scheduler.
Raises:
  • HttpError – there was an error in the request.
  • ApiError – the operation is not allowed (see exception details)
upload_testset(name, description, categories, conf_files)¶

Uploads a test set with the given name, categories and configuration files (list of Configuration objects).

The testset will be available in the database as soon as it is validated by a maintainer.

If a VALIDATED testset with the same name already exists, an ApiError is raised. If a non-validated testset with the same name already exists, it will be overriden if you are the author of the existing test set.

Parameters:
  • name (str) – name of the test set to upload
  • description (str) – description of the test set to upload.
  • categories (list of str) – categories linked to the test set. They must already exist in the DB.
Raises:
  • HttpError – there was an error in the request.
  • ApiError – the operation is not allowed (see exception details)
